** simple \color
.
\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{xcolor}

\begin{document}
\color[cmyk]{1,0,0,0}
\color[wave]{485}
\color{red}
This is \textcolor{magenta}{kind of red} text.
\end{document}
.
<div class="body">
<p>This is  text.</p>
</div>
.


** \color expressions
.
\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{xcolor}

\begin{document}
\color{-red}
\color{red!50}
\color{-green!40!yellow}
\color{--red!50!green!12.345}
\color{red!50!green!20!blue}
\color{foo!!+}
\color{foo!![7]}
\color{foo!25!red!!+++}
\color{foo!25!red!70!green!![7]}

\color{rgb:-green!40!yellow,3;green!40!yellow,2;red,1}
\color{rgb:red,1}
\color{cmyk:red,1;-green!25!blue!60,11.25;blue,-2}
\end{document}
.
<div class="body">
<p>This is  text.</p>
</div>
.


** defining colors
.
\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{xcolor}

\definecolor{red}{rgb}{1,0,0}
\definecolor{red}{rgb}{1,0,0}
\definecolor{red}{rgb/cmyk}{1,0,0/0,1,1,0}
\definecolor{red}{hsb:rgb/cmyk}{1,0,0/0,1,1,0}
\definecolor[named]{Black}{cmyk}{0,0,0,1}

\definecolor{myblack}{named}{Black}

\definecolorset{cmyk/rgb/hsb/gray}{}{}%
 {cyan,1,0,0,0/0,1,1/.5,1,1/.7;%
  magenta,0,1,0,0/1,0,1/.83333,1,1/.41;%
  yellow,0,0,1,0/1,1,0/.16667,1,1/.89;%
  olive,0,0,1,.5/.5,.5,0/.16667,1,.5/.39}


\begin{document}
\end{document}
.
<div class="body">
<p>This is  text.</p>
</div>
.
